user_device_rel: 1 person to n devices; n people to m devices
device_mount: Placed loosely around user (e.g., table); Handheld
tracking_range: field of view of a tablet's camera
use_cases_desc:
- Transferring of virtual elements between tablets to sort objects
- Collaborative jigsaw puzzle. Tablets are arrange side by side and puzzle pieces can be transferred across the "canvas" made out of multiple tablets.
evaluation: Quality measurements (e.g., accuracy of tracking); User study (quantitative, controlled lab experiment)
contribution_desc:
The paper explores the suitability of mid-air gestures for educational games with children, using the previous work of MarkAirs. The authors describe two use-case games that can be used with school children to for exploring and learning, using multiple devices as controlers and displays in AR.  
They then report on a quantitatve study with school children, evaluating the accuracy of mid-air AR interaction for school children.
tracking_accuracy: error rates: 27px for translation; 8.41 degrees for rotation; 4.97% error rate for scaling
tracking_characteristic: Outside-in tracking; Location 3D; Tracking devices only
interaction_techniques: Manipulation of content on tablets; control of content; AR manipulation
contribution: Use-case, application; Interaction techniques; Study (human factors)
crossdevice_def:
"[...] several recent works (e.g., [4,19]) have attempted to build Multi-Display Environments (MDEs) in a way that several devices are placed near one another on a flat surface (e.g., a table) and belong to the same logical workplace."

"[...] table-like shape provides in-creased awareness [...] parallel interaction, and, therefore, support for social and collaborative activities [16], whose benefits in learning have been widely reported in the literature"
